headline: Jobs report, Big Oil earnings, de minimis closure: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime anchor Julie Hyman previews the biggest market stories and data due out for Friday, May 2, namely the April jobs report, earnings from Big Oil producers Exxon Mobil (XOM), Chevron (CVX), and Shell (SHEL), and the closing date for de minimis exemptions on low-value imports from China into the US. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: Court hearing in Exxon's dispute over Chevron-Hess deal set for May 26, sources say
summary: HOUSTON (Reuters) -The International Chamber of Commerce has scheduled a hearing in Exxon Mobil's arbitration dispute over rival Chevron's planned acquisition of oil producer Hess for May 26, according to two sources familiar with the matter.  It has delayed Chevron's $53-billion deal to buy Hess, which was announced nearly 18 months ago.
